subject: Career
title: Loss Aversion in Salary Decisions
description: A fast breakdown of Loss Aversion in Salary Decisions for builders.

hook.text: A $5K pay cut hurts twice as much as a $5K raise feels good. That's loss aversion.

buildup.text: Kahneman and Tversky showed losses loom larger than equivalent gains in every decision.

discovery.text: This is why people stay in underpaying jobs â€” leaving feels like losing certainty.

twist.text: Employers use this too. 'You might lose your bonus' is scarier than 'you could earn a bonus.'

climax.text: Reframe: you're not losing your current job. You're gaining a better one.

punchline.text: Fear of loss keeps you underpaid. Reframe to move.

quiz.question: How does loss aversion affect salary decisions?
options: People avoid leaving underpaying jobs due to fear of losing certainty
